title: Buttons
content:

  • ››Buttons

Buttons

  • Service Call Buttons
  • New Tab or New Window Buttons
  • Pop-Up Buttons
  • Using Conditional Queries for Buttons
  • Conditional Hiding 
  • Troubleshooting
    • Edit buttons are not aligned properly in the Order Total section using the UI extension
    • Buttons are misaligned when more than one button extensions are configured
  • Related Articles

Three types of custom action buttons can be added to execute a specific action from the UI: Service Call, New Tab, New Window, or Pop-Up (see Extensions.ExtensionDetail.ExtensionProperties.Button.Action).

Service Call Buttons

With the click of the button, the application calls the API URL with relevant inputs as defined in the metadata (See Extensions.ExtensionDetail.ExtensionProperties.URL). This call can be GET or POST based on the CallType (See Extensions.ExtensionDetail.ExtensionProperties.Button.callType). The API must follow the format as defined by the base application. Buttons can also be shown conditionally. (See Extensions.ExtensionDetail.ExtensionProperties.Button.ConditionURL)

New Tab or New Window Buttons

This button launches a new browser tab or a new window with the defined URL (See Extensions.ExtensionDetail.ExtensionProperties.URL). 

Whenever button extensions are implemented with some query params, on clicking the button, the UI will pass the params from the main web URL to all custom URL.

Pop-Up Buttons

The pop-up buttons can be used to open a new pop-up window. With a click of the button, the application opens a pop-up dialog with an embedded iframe that loads the content from the URL (See Extensions.ExtensionDetail.ExtensionProperties.URL here) defined. You can also control whether the base UI should be refreshed at the close of the pop-up window. For example, if you have changed the state of the entity in the pop-up which is shown in the underlying base UI, you need to refresh the base UI to reflect the updates.

Using Conditional Queries for Buttons

If a button should be conditionally displayed, a condition query can be added. For example:

..."ConditionURL": "/com-manh-cp-ext-dsgnordercomponent/api/ext/uiGrant//display/cancelledlineinfo/grant/verify",
  "ConditionQuery": "OrderLine.IsCancelled=true",
  "URLParams": [
    {
      "ParamObject": "Order",
      "ParamName": "OrderId"
    },
    {
      "ParamObject": "OrderLine",
      "ParamName": "OrderLineId"
    }
  ],
  "ConditionResponseData": "data"...

As part of the response data, the API will give the following:

{
  "data": {
    "Disabled": true,
    "Hidden": false,
    "ToolTip": "string",
    "OverrideText": "string"
  }
}

Conditional Hiding 

To conditionally disable custom buttons, the response of the conditional URL API should be:

{
  "data": {
    "Disabled": true
  }
}
 

You can also have optional tooltip and override text in the response


{
  "data": {
    "Disabled": true,
    "Hidden": false,
    "ToolTip": "string",
    "OverrideText": "string"
  }
}
 

The configuration should be:

{
    "ExtensionId": "edit-order-header-action",
    "ExtensionDetail": [
        {
            "ExtensionType": "button",
            "ExtensionProperties": {
                "Label": "Save",
                "Sequence": 1,
                "URL": https://www.google.com,
                "Button": {
                    "Type": "button",
                    "Action": "newtab",
                    "Style": {
                        "background-color": "#4a90e2",
                        "color": "#ffffff",
                        "margin": "0 0.5rem 0 0.5rem"
                    },
                    "ConditionURL": https://demo7004666.mockable.io/installmentoptions,
                    "ConditionResponseData": "data"
                }
            }
        }
    ]
}

Troubleshooting

Edit buttons are not aligned properly in the Order Total section using the UI extension

Issue: While adding three charges with the requirement to have the edit button (pencil icon) only for 2 charges, the alignment of the edit buttons is not proper.

Troubleshooting Steps: If you have 3 fields configured in one extension, it is recommended that all the 3 buttons are configured and not just 2 of them since they are aligned in a table-type format. To achieve your requirement, you can use the field extension to configure just one field without the pencil icon.

Buttons are misaligned when more than one button extensions are configured

Example, when multiple icons are configured and one icon is hidden conditionally, the other icons are misaligned.

Solution: Instead of hiding an icon, disable it conditionally. The expected response for API is

{
"Disabled" : false, "Hidden" : false, "ToolTip" : "tooltip", "OverrideText" : "Test1"
}
